User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0b8) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b8
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0b8) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b8

When resuming from hibernation mode, the FF window content is lost/not redrawn and just a plain white/gray area is visible. To force the screen content being repainted, the FF window has to be resized. Partial screen updates are also possible by hovering around with the mouse.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Firefox, open some pages, maximize window
2. Put your machine into hibernation
3. Resume from hibernation

Actual Results:  
After resuming and logging in, you can see that the Firefox window content is not restored. The only thing readable is the title bar. You can move your mouse around and some small portions of the window content are redrawn. Moving other windows over the Firefox window does not cause any further content to be redrawn. If you resize the window, all content is redrawn.

Expected Results:  
After resuming from hibernation, the full window content should be visible without any further manual actions.

This seems to be a regression in FF4b8, I didn't observe this in FF4b7.

Although bug 593858 has nothing to do with hibernation mode, it may be related.

comments.raw_text:
>Driver Date              1-2-2008
Uh, can you please update your drivers ?

This should be the right driver for the quadro FX 570M and german as language:
http://www.nvidia.de/object/notebook-winxp-260.99-whql-driver-de.html

You could do another test before updating the driver.
Disable the (graphic) hardware acceleration in tools/options/advanced/general and restart Firefox. After that try the hibernate case.

I think we should blocklist such an old driver version if the new driver fixes the problem.
